final_answer.precision_note: Kc to 3 s.f., limited by given moles (3 s.f.) and volume (3 s.f.).

method: Convert moles to equilibrium concentrations using the vessel volume 2.00 dm3. [NO2] = 0.180 mol / 2.00 dm3 = 0.0900 mol dm-3. [N2O4] = 0.220 mol / 2.00 dm3 = 0.110 mol dm-3. Use Kc = [NO2]^2 / [N2O4]. Substitute: Kc = (0.0900)^2 / 0.110 = 0.00810 / 0.110 = 0.0736 (dimensionless).
checks: Both concentrations are < 0.2/2 = 0.1 mol dm-3 scale, so Kc should be around (0.09^2)/0.11 â‰ˆ 0.07, matching.
If [NO2] were higher relative to [N2O4], Kc would increase; squaring [NO2] makes this sensitivity clear.
